etymologies: early 19th century (in quetzal (sense 1)): from Spanish, from Aztec quetzalli ‘brightly colored tail feather’

definitions: a bird of the trogon family, with iridescent green plumage and typically red underparts, found in the forests of tropical America.

notes.text: Genus Pharomachrus, family Trogonidae: five species, especially the resplendent quetzal (P. mocinno), the male of which has very long tail coverts and was venerated by the Aztecs

shortDefinitions: bird of trogon family, with iridescent green plumage, found in forests of tropical America

definitions: the basic monetary unit of Guatemala, equal to 100 centavos.
shortDefinitions: basic monetary unit of Guatemala, equal to 100 centavos
